Vansh brings the greatest vibe at any given moment and is always there for you. I'll remember him as the guy who gave his support when I twisted my ankle. I've shared some of my best moments with you and I'll always treasure our friendship bro :))

I'll always remember u as someone so kind,energetic,full of life-jab bhi dekho u r running yaha se waha.v spent some great time together-from the pizza party at thub terrace to the dog park day(v both were visibly the only ones who enjoyed).oh & ofc the time spent in microsoft playing TT & carrom till late night,it was so fun.u asking me to tie a rakhi remains one of my best & cute memories w u.I wish u all things great & can't wait to see the cool stuff u'll do.stay in touch & bhool mat jana💖
Vansh is the person who can vibe with my coffee addiction the most. Hope to drink starbucks together one day when we are both rich :P. Cheers!

You're legit one of the chillest dudes I know 😌. So glad you're gonna be around for at least another year! We absolutely HAVE to cook up some sick research and get things moving fast. Beyond the grind, you're just an awesome, level-headed guy to hang with. More good times & big brain sessions to come! 🔥
It's always great to say hi, as you always have a smile on your face !!  Always stay lively and joyful :)

I have first-hand experience of closely working with Vansh for an important conference submission. The way he handles things step-by-step and not panicking regardless of how terrible the situation is and constantly thinking about different solutions to the problem at hand is something I wish to incorporate in myself in future. I still think there is something there in the "black coffee" which he drinks that allows him to stay so relaxed and sharp. Good luck for future endeavours :)

Vansh is perfect husband material. He is extremely smart and capable of sustaining an intellectual conversation, while being deep, mature and caring at the same time (hence the first line). I've always seen Vansh sincerely give his 100% in his work, and I admire him for that. He is also capable of talking and theorizing about the most random brain-rot stuff, which I had the privilege of experiencing. Vansh has snuck in many of my core memories and I love him for that, UwU bro, All the best

Hello there fellow 312 resident (oh, honorary), Vansh the meretrix :) Will never forget the fun times we had in Bakul, peak bakchodi thi fr. You're one of those people I found in this college who are just as humble as talented and smart. Thanks for all the DSA help. And I REALLY hope you actually learn the guitar someday, dummy.
Stay in touch :))

Somehow you stuck with the GNU nickname to this day🙏No pinching pls 😭 We are NOT gonna talk about the character you played in the shipwreck skit. Very very hardworking guy. Needs to chill out a bit. Somehow doesn't stay in mess for more than 10 minutes. Here's to hoping we'll have a slightly more balanced 5th year 😅🍻

Haa Vansh :)
I would tell my friends someday, that I once push around a crazy smart guy on wheelchair. A true inspiration, that convinced me to start sleeping in the lab ;)
Lot of fun memories with you, from back in the Euleroid days, to theory group, psycho project and unlimited mafia :)
But actually, your passion for work is crazy, and its insane how you make every conversation about CV so fun :)

Heyy,
Whenever I was like aaj mood nahi or kal karte hai, you’d just appear out of nowhere—speed walking, speed eating—and it felt like a sign from the universe. That energy genuinely pushed me to stay up and study. Your dedication and consistency really are something else, Vansh.

Loved all our meals and random convos—and hey, one more year for me to keep hearing about Papa😄
Wishing you the most and more, always.

Hello the guitarist of CVIT!!.. 
You have multiple memories in my college life starting our CVIT journey together and talking about our projects and ideas for hours.. I am amazed by your determination for things you like.. Maintain your sleep cycle well is only suggestion I have for you :-) Wishing all the luck for your future. Stay happy.. Keep in touch✌️.

Vansh, you're one of my dearest friends. Even though we haven't talked as much as I would’ve liked over the past two years, that doesn’t change a thing. I’ve never met someone so hardworking, kind, and full of enthusiasm. Talking to you always lifts my spirits, and I truly enjoy every conversation we have. You deserve so much more—great things are waiting for you. Stay in touch - my one and only "vaishya"!!

Theory Group lesgoo! Was fun discussing random things with you, especially
in theory Thursdays. Sad you didn't join quantum tho :(
Vansh lives on coffee, never sleeps, works like a machine—and still managed to break his leg like it was part of the plan.

Such a thoughtful and sweet soul. From pizza at KCIS terrace, to the walks we had through campus, they have all been memorable. I need to learn how to be so simple and humble from you genuinely. Thank you for listening to all my rants in your room, and always being so helpful. We both might end up being the last people to graduate from our batch, so atleast we can suffer together :) Stay the same and good luck on everything ahead!

name: Sreenivas Bhumireddy Papireddy
tagline: If u expect failure; u can never be disappointed🙃

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: On the first day I entered campus, I saw a long-haired person entering near security before me, later I saw this person at the Bakul entrance, I was confused whether it was the boys' hostel. It was Sreyas Badami 🫨, we became roommates🙃.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: The night of random convo, random jobless activities before everyone leaves for summer vacation in general, but after sem-2 was the most memorable.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: Bitching about my life to people who are in much worse position them. Did that with everyone, but like flexing who has the worst lifestyle.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Maturity, understanding that "asking why" before doing anything that people around u are also doing is very important, as asking myself if that is what I want.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: I am a Dual Degree 🙃 - research.

testimonials.text: Sreenivas has been a solid roommate—always around but somehow always “too busy” to hang out. Classic move: saying he’s got tons of work, then chilling anyway. Gonna miss the chaos, the rants, and the unexpected wisdom. Room won't be the same without you, bro!

Sreenivas, you are one of the most unique personalities on campus and my personal favourite. I will never forget my time with you during CG, taking care of you when you broke your leg and just having random chats with you. Our team name has been consistently after you, "BHUMIREDDY PAPPIREDDIES" as you mean good luck to us. You are super fun and have a great ringtone. Wherever we are, whatever we are doing, and in whatsoever ways are stories are moulding, know that you will always be my DIRECTOR.

Basically single and ready to mingle, pls contact him if interested.
That aside, basically 3rd roommate - would stay over in my room overnight to dedicatedly do assignments, projects or studying, basically forgetting what sleep even means (taking a 30 minute powernap to last a whole extra day, then putting the softest alarms known to man). Basically needs to be informed well in advance if planning any outings, very busy person :D
Basically fitness enthusiast, intellect of a God...

Sreenivas.. Director saab..
One of the first friends I made in college. I spent so much time in your room, you and Harshit. My constant company in train as well, not anymore :( . 
Did so many things for the first time with you, like trips, nightouts, movie nights.
You have naturally gotten style bro. Those badminton shots that you play are nothing short of Anime fight scenes xD.
PS : I am never taking course suggestions from you again.. Psychology and GnD is what you suggest -_-

Sreenivas is the man, the myth, the legend, the DIRECTOR. He is the kind of guy that lives his life at 2x speed and is always doing something. I'll always remember him as the man who gave me those pep talks during placements and with his name, guided us towards losing in the Cricket tournament 1st round for 2 years straight, and also that guy who grinded spatial informatics till late in the night. I'll always remember Sreenivas as the unforgettable character that he is.

Sreenivas – truly one of the most innocent souls you’ll ever meet! A wonderful friend whose presence can brighten anyone’s day. His working style might be a little unconventional—after all, who else chooses humanities for a CSD thesis? But that’s exactly what makes him unique. Keep shining with your brilliance wherever life takes you!

Dancing together was the start of our college experience and I wish we had spent more time early on. I feel like a lot of what you do resonates with me, and to me, you feel like the most similar person in the entire college. Your fiery passion and drive are a sight to behold, even when it is for the most minuscule things imaginable. I hope that we find more time to spend together in our last year, and I wish the best for you, wherever you go and whatever you do.

Met you online during the first sem. Don't call yourself an introvert, man. You're a hardworking guy and were a great help in projects, I really enjoyed studying with you. Love your humor and sarcasm too. Take care of yourself bro, phir se pair mat tudwa lena, aur dil bhi. All the best for your future! See you in blr.

Sreenivas always keeps worrying about something (tension about work), yet his company is most valuable to me. I love the fact that you come to my room, even though you say its for my mattress ;). I hope all your future endeavours come unto fruitation.

sreenivas :) one of the most innocent guys i have met, you are such a selfless nice friend. will forever cherish the time we spent making Pathaan 2.0 in the blue room in ws!

even though we sometimes went too far in making jokes around you (THE DIRECTOR!), you never faltered and always laughed along.  cannot be thankful enough to call you a friend, you are one guy made of gold! 

love you and wish you all the best in life!

Director! 🎬 To this day, I have ZERO clue why people call you that, but it's legendary lmao. Absolutely love the times with you, bro - our group legit has the BEST vibes! Rooting for your economics research to bring you some massive success! 📈 So hyped to hang out a LOT more in the upcoming year now that we've got nothing but research on our plates. Here's to all the epic fun times ahead! 🍻

This guy always claims he's swamped, counting even his sleep time-whether alone or with his girlfriends-as part of his "busy" schedule. He feels so overwhelmed that he skips typing messages, opting for voice-to-text, leaving us to decipher his cryptic words. He's constantly obessing over his girlfriends and flexing his muscles around Rushil (showing off with some questionable vibes). Everything, including dining out, needs to be booked a month in advance.
Hi Sreenivas !! Dude its so good to get to know ya - you are one of the most genuine persons I met on campus and a truly trustworthy friend. Stay happy buddy - All the best !!
Will miss random t-hub discussions. Best econ TA ever.  All the best bro
One of the kindest people I've met. Is way easier to talk using voice than via messages.
Thanks for letting me use your name from time to time ;)

You were one of few people, with whom I talked about politics in college. Those discussions were really satisfying and you were clearly well informed on all subject. Hope we can continue this in future too.

name: Anushka Jain
tagline: too hot to write a cool caption

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: meeting himani for the first time ever (also nandini and mallika). getting caught w himani trying to break out of quarantine during felicity buzz, being shit scared through the night

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: nights spent in sreeja and muskan's room with the gang, feni night w kriti and himani when we didn't sleep throughout the night, diwali with akshit

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: being able to go to my friends' rooms whenever i like

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: knowing who the people are who i can actually rely on

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: living in a walkable city with the amazing people i met here

testimonials.text:
It's wild to think that when we first spoke at Theos, CP during online sem, I had no idea Anushka would become the anchor of my college life. I genuinely don't think I'd have made it without her - her steady presence saved me more times than I can count. 
She's the kindest person I know: listens closely, speaks honestly and treats everyone with respect; also absurdly capable, from leading fashion/queer clubs to algo research. OOM, but I'm lucky to carry college with me, because she’s part of it.

youre definitely the best roommate in the world. i still can't believe how we managed to become roommates randomly, but it was also the most perfect fit imaginable. i didn't think it was possible to be this comfortable living with someone. i loved doing everything we did; it wasn't just easy but also just so fun. i'll miss us enjoying music together under the fairy lights, and i'm so so happy that we hung out one last time in jahnavi's room. it felt, for a bit, like we were back in ours.

anushkaa most nicest delhi person I have ever met?? ty for always feeding us the best food (maybe sometimes too salty) and for recruiting me into fashion club. forever not going to believe that you are actually taller than me and forever going to be mad at you for not bringing frodo with you to college </3

nushkaaaa, you know what I love about you? I love that you have such thoughtful, yet crazyyy ideas which I can for some reason never say no to. I swear you are down to the most last min plans and adventures (remember our first one with orgho at atrium and currently our last party planning one). All I want for the next year is to continue doing those random shit and I loveee you byee

jez 500 chars would never be enough for me to write abt u. im so glad ur my friend. u really were the first person I met on campus at the entrance of c block with ur mom, and u were the last person I hugged and saw right b4 leaving old parijaat, and then theres everything in b/w <3 u genuinely make me so happy. u have the best & the sweetest energy & I LOVE just being around u. thank u for being there for me at my highs and my lows. so many of my core memories are w u being girls w u is the best

hi jez!! I think this a lot but idk if I’ve said it: you’re one of the smartest, coolest people I’ve ever known and I mean it. I admire you so much and I’m so glad we got added to JC together so we got to be friends for all 4 years :)
It feels so trivial to list all this, because this friendship is so much more than the sum of all the little things —but Rouge, Queer Club, CSTAR, Old Parijaat, every session, every night out or in, every trip—was what it was because you were there.

anushkaaa. youre so so sweet and pretty and nice and im so so happy we became friends. literally mom of the group the way youre always taking care of us (and cooking for us). i love the way you listen to people and make them feel seen youre soo nice. youre so pretty and i love your fashion sense smm. invite me to your wedding please <3

nushkaaa jez

love you <3 you're so cool and smart and sweet and driven
just as much as you are stunning and inspiring

you're the best catto and doggo mommy (maybe even my mommy?? :point_right::point_left:)

I feel very cool being your friend :0
I love you -- keep shining <3

Ive really enjoyed being your friend ever since the original jc, because you were always so sweet and kind. I love that youre not afraid to be blunt with people and tell them when they mess up. Youre also very creative and fashionable, hope we get to go out more next sem, your birthday group was so fun. Im very excited to be near to you in bangalore and hang out next sem. Your room has been my go to whenever i want to get my mind off things and im very grateful for that.

anushka jain, my first friend in iiit, right from online sem, and now we're diving into fifth year, still as friends. you're one of the nicest people I've met on campus, and inlp also was so fun with you. the only reason fifth year shouldn't be that bad is cos people like you will be there and i hope to hang out with you a lot :))

You are honestly such a nice, pretty, sweet, caring, smart person. It is hard to come across people like you and I am grateful to be able to call you a friend. I have had some of my most fun memories with you and omg you are sooo goofy and such an amazing person to be around. Here's to a lifetime of trips, cooking, gossips and sessions (of all kinds) <3 <3

Dear Anushka,
You are one of the smartest people I've ever met. Having discussions and conversations with you is like talking to a wise old sage. Not assertive at all, but speaks with profound clarity and nuance. I am really glad to have met you and to have made your friendship.

nuskaaaaa you are the nuska for all of my problemss. so glad i got to know you these last few years and will miss anushkas kitchen (and your overly salty pasta) ty for being the coolest nicest person ive ever met ill miss you :(
Hanging out with binloo (and you) was soo fun <3 so was using your steamer thing for extra curricular activities. And yes i'd absolutely love for you to come visit (every single time) <3

the best mixologist and cook I know (going to miss those momos and cum laude drinks lol). loved geeking out over nazia and russian lit with you. def coming over so we can celebrate our birthdays back-to-back again <3

jez!!! you''re the best. always so nice and joyful. so many memories. jc, cp journey, pikm, red lorry (!!!), fellow HEAT (1995) fan, and just in general. has been a pleasure being friends, and hopefully we will talk even more in the coming year. also if i ever land up in delhi im hitting you up to take me to big chill for the banoffee 🔪🔪 love you and keepp smiling :)

anushkaaa, you're one of the sweetest people on campus!! thank you for making my first couple of years in college so much fun. somehow if i ever took a weird/goofy course you were always in it 😭. you also have the cutest dog ever and i need to somehow meet frodo at some point
Anushka, you’re always up for a good time! I’ll never forget the farewell after-party chaos. You’re fun to talk to, and TAing Discrete Structures with you was a good time!

anushka, you’re so sweet and kind. going out with you was always so much fun—i miss all those times. i really enjoyed being teammates with you in ESW, even though our project sucked. you’re such a fun person to be around. take care, and I hope we stay in touch <3

jezzzz, you are the nicest person ever, doing projects with you never felt like work and partying with you was always so fun. i am so glad that you aren't leaving. let's have a lot of fun next year. steaming hot hoemos forever <33
Best CO TA.. always had fun correcting papers ranting about jrs late night... Will miss those days.... I wish you all the best for your future and I hope you get everything you need
Anushka, you're such a fashion icon! You are super sweet and kind and so fun to talk to to <3

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Getting to know how big our campus was 😂.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Movie streamings, group outings, club events, and a bunch of other small moments on campus are what I’ll remember most.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I’ll definitely miss my friends the most—those late-night conversations, spontaneous outings, and working on projects together.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I’ve somewhat become better at talking to people and handling academic things when they get stressful.

testimonials.text:
9 yrs since we first met! From the excitement of getting into IIITH together to you being my 1st ever roomie, every moment has been made more real and special becoz of u. We've had our share of fights, but they're overshadowed by so many absolutely amazing memories that I'll always treasure.
I learned so much on this journey with you by my side. I'm going to miss you a lot ❤️ . And you know, talk when you need to, rant when you feel like it just know that I will always be a phone call away for u

My cutest friend. Friend of 9 yrs. College gave me a beautiful soul, and loyal friend I could ever get. I will never forget endless sodhi muchatlu and the endless kdrama discussions we had. Sorry for munching all your snacks (sorry but not sorry heheh). Thank you so so much for understanding me and thanks for staying by my side. We are far away just wrt distance, but I'm just one message away. I don't know how to sum up our bond, I will conclude this by saying that I love you so so much.
#104

Map lo araku, manali matrame ayyayi, inka chala unnai. For many reasons, I believe that I can follow you every time I’m confused. Naku okka korika, I want to see you screaming in a movie. Next year, you can’t skip any plans, manaki unna picchi fantasies anni terchukovachu. Let's become Ambiverts at least.

Neetho spend chesina time ni chala enjoy chesanu. Nuvvu choopinche care concern naaku chala istam. Mana drama discussions ni chala miss avtanu. Thank you for the good time and sweet memories that we shared together

Only word gets to my mind when I hear keerthi, heroine hehe.Apart from jokes we both are so similar always glued to our phones at corners of our gatherings.You look so serious from far, but you are so sweet ra. I am always suprised how you eat from yuktahar frequently raa, so diligent gurl. I am still in awe you look good always raa how, you gonna be my model for the next year. I am gonna stick to you, tighten the seatbelt and njoy th roller coaster ride.Simply let's have fun ra.

From labmates to close friends, it all began with random conversations that somehow never stopped. Keerthi gets annoyed way too easily—especially when it comes to pranks! She loves watching movies, but only Telugu... please try Hindi as well, they are good too T_T . Short in height but huge in brainpower—just believe in yourself. You’ve got what it takes. Wishing you all the success and happiness ahead.

ESW team project.. deenivalle parichayam ayyav. Gender course appudu ekkuva conversations ayyayi. Complete dedication tho untav, and best efforts pedatav. Hard-working person. Manali trip lo manchi memories unnayi - kalisi trek chesam, delhi lo tirigaam,.. Had good conversations and funny moments with you. Much fun ahead!
All the best! Keep smiling..

I wish you all the best for your future and I hope you get everything you need

Ig our frndship started with Felicity ride, and continued in RSAI. My first co-author.. Keeping professional things aside, I always wanted to spend more time with you.. Kalvadam, calls matladam was always an aid for me in tough times. We might be volatile and not being able to do anything that often frnds do. Thanks for being dora for this Bujji. Hope we will spend more time together at least in 5th year and hoping same from you. You are strongest threshold I ever got to move on with things. :-)
Hardworking person with Sweet, charming and innocent personality. Hope you acheive a lot in life and would love to stay in touch
Sweet friend,  really wonderful artist ( naaku ayithe minimum skill ledhu) and also bonding over your mom being my math teacher was really nice re, wish you the best!
We didn’t talk much during college, but I genuinely wish her all the very best for whatever lies ahead. Hope the future brings her success, happiness, and everything she hopes for.

name: Sarthak Chittawar
tagline: Don't worry, I've already jinxed it.

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Almost went into Nilgiri thinking it was Bakul. I've always loved the greenery in campus and hope it stays the same for a long time. Quarantine days were quite fun as well.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Night cricket with friends, this was fun but also led to me meeting a really nice group of friends who are almost like family to me now. BB nights, partying in kiik, zythum, red rhino, felicity, coldplay, goa, pondi - i can name so many things but words aren't enough to describe how much fun we had.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I'm really gonna miss my friends and their presence on campus, at least the single degree ones. 4th year was incredibly fun with 2 trips in 2 months, and then the numerous times I went out with them, apart from living life to the fullest in campus.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I've matured as a person, become more caring of others. Built very strong relationships with people I didn't even interact with back then. Also improved considerably in acads lol, but that's fine.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Getting my Dual Degree, then probably try out many different things for my initial work years. I dream to travel the world by 2030.

testimonials.text: xorggg, photogenic mf, this shit still cracks me up, thx to purini, will miss listening to you sing and perform, you cutting the rope in house party ukwim 😂, playing rdr 24/7. big time f1 enthusiast, we both need to hit Miami gp once bro with your gator cousin also, increase your attention span to more than a goldfish's da, you'll get more returns on your stocks😂, loved going to Coldplay - surreal and thanks for being the story guy. please keep livestreaming on WA, im gonna miss it

This guy man. Convincing us to come for coldplay was the best thing that could've happened (I wish we somehow convinced ourselves to stay for Goa as well), but yes only the first of many concerts to come inshallah. Nicki Minaj Silicone

xorgggg u r like best travel planner ever like coldplay, goa everything u planned even though last minute it was crazy da. trips were sooo fun and getting drunk with you is the best like so goood. you r the best and im so happy i became your friend even though it was so late. obviously, u r the best singer ik , you have a crazy voice u need to consider changing ur career path that good u r. sarthakkk

you're so cool and super fun and very smart
you have the best voice - cannot wait to keep making music with you 

so glad we got close this past year (bangalore gang days notwithstanding :0) - and can't wait to hang out a lot more in the next year + many years to come :)

best singer in night cricket hands down. you really have a crazy good voice. very funny & chronically online guy. the Sarthak Messaging Service is appreciated. man might overtake rushil this year with his 'predictions'. fellow RDR enjoyer and big kohli fan. the guy who has the most fun I think after weve all had a couple glasses of juice. extremely photogenic. hopefully the krishna in your life will let you have enough free time to do cool shit next sem. also pls eat stuff other than bhakharwadi

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Greenery everywhere - experiencing the Chhichhore scene! Finally met my online friend Maharnav before quarantine. 4th-floor isolation turned into unexpected fun—bonding, laughter, and memories from day one.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Won Megathon 2023 with an amazing team! Pulled my first all-nighter—code crashed just before presentation. Fixed it half-asleep in 5 mins! Hilarious moments: Divij's rapid speech vs Harshit's slide changes. Perfect chaos!

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I'll miss those long & endless talks—sometimes random or sometimes on deep topics—in the Bakul gallery, mess table or on after-dinner walks.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: The biggest change since my first year has been my growth in confidence. Coming from a shy, introverted background, college—especially my involvement in clubs and student leadership—helped me evolve. Through organizing events, I’ve learned people management, teamwork, and the value of discipline, shaping me into a more outgoing and organized individual. Also, learnt watching more & more movies to spend free time :)

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Gonna change the world. Right after I finish watching all the Hindi movies...

testimonials.text: He's explored more of GitHub than the actual globe. Need a movie recommendation? He'll expertly acknowledge the title you just fed him. Need a joke that will make you question your life choices (in a good way)? He's got an endless supply. A truly unique specimen!

Bhav is one of the most organized people I have met in college. He is the type who puts a lot of effort into making considerations like "Which courses" and "Which mess" and I just tagged along with him on all those things XD (okay maybe not with messes).

With him also comes free access to random news articles, facts, and videos via WhatsApp. It was a really fun college life finding someone who had a similar vision and thoughts about college life as I did and I can not appreciate this enough.

Bhav’s the coding ninja—can build a website in no time but won’t spend a single rupee even if the world’s ending. If frugality were an Olympic sport, he’d win gold. Always leading events like a pro, just don’t ask him to pay for snacks. Legend in his own thrifty way!

Bhav was the first friend I made when the college became offline. One of the most dedicated people I have seen, I still remember the times when we used to watch movies in his room, and the only thing that concerned him was working on the Clubs Council website. We had a great time together in all the movies and restaurants we went to. Whether it’s work or fun, Bhav brings a sense of commitment and joy and he's a great person to hang out with.

Widest range of connections.
Indianmoviepaglu. Bhav the Builder.
If someone's even 30 seconds late for the mess, he’ll unleash his inner aunty faster than you can say “paneer”! Reliable, punctual, and dramatically annoying— like a 2000s movie in human form.

All the best bro for the future and whatever you want to achieve in the near future!

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Well, first day included meeting my roommate and getting locked with her for 4 days quarantine (xD). I still remember spending my first Felicity stuck in Parijat! So I consider my "true" first day to be after quarantine—spent the WHOLE DAY walking and talking to everyone :p.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Felicity Buzz 2022 probably! Best DJ Night and gossip sesh with seniors—unforgettable (most of it at least xD). Late-night practices and prep for dance/events were some of my best memories with juniors <3 And yeah Farewell 2024 (the one we threw)... the less I say the better!

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: Tbh JC and Davids ke bhaiyas and aunty is who I'll miss a lot! They have probably seen it all, eavesdropped on all our post-night-out debriefs and laughed at our bakchodi. Walking around campus, saying hi, and randomly starting conversations or rants anytime, anywhere..that'll be hard to let go of!

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Me becoming an absolute biriyani-holic! Also I feel like I've become eternally nocturnal lol. I've learnt insane multi-tasking skills through everything. One of my biggest life lessons was definitely learning everything that can go wrong will go wrong is real, and how to deal with that as well! And I think my favourite change would be my ability (or so I think) to be scary and commanding- thank you dance practices! Also dilli waalon see seekha gaali kaise dena hota hai :)

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Ooh that's something I genuinely feel like going with the flow for! Hopefully a nice job in a nice city with easy access to the beach! I hope I travel a lot and eat to my hearts content. Maybe an MBA abroad somewhere down the line, who knows. I really hope I'm still dancing often and I can't wait to dance at everyone's weddings lol :) Oh and I definitely need a Goa 2.0 with college friends someday <3

name: Harshit Aggarwal
tagline: Too curious to stay quiet, too awkward to disappear.

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: First day of quarantine. Early morning, my roommate and I were fast asleep when a loud crash woke us up. For a moment, we were scared. Then we saw it—the fan had fallen from the ceiling, right between us! We laughed. There we had a story for the "Intros".

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: I loved all our late-night cycle trips; each one had its own vibe. In some, we ended up watching a random movie after parking our cycles at a mall and came back around 4 AM. In others, we rode for over 50 km straight with no destination, only to crawl back to campus half-dead but fully alive.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: Late-night talks and fun with friends, movie nights with snacks, and, of course, waking up every day just to talk to your crush. I’ll miss the unplanned adventures, the chaos, and the inside jokes. The college events weren’t grand, but the memories made were priceless.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I went from being an introvert who barely spoke to anyone to wearing a saree and walking in front of the entire batch. From struggling with deadlines to managing time like a pro.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Khaenge, piyenge, paisa chapenge aur kya

testimonials.text: Harshit is one of those rare friends you simply can’t forget. Together we went for countless outings, rode bicycles through the streets at 1 A.M, went for a couple of trips outside of Hyderabad, and he would always find ways to make every single one of them memorable. I'll always remember the absolutely unnecessary all-nighters we pulled just talking about life. He's always up for something new—and drags us along too 😄. Grateful for having a friend like him :)

The most punctual and lazy guy(yes, idk how) I will ever meet, man, the dedication this guy has to studying something I admire a lot and tried emulating, obviously failed miserably 😭. Man plans his life like a video game. Beyond that, he doesn't know how to stop teasing or keeping secrets; he jokes about things with no limits.  A very reliable, awesome guy, ..... more than that, one of a kind, I don't think I will ever meet anyone like him again. Thanks for being a good roommate, brother.

Despite being in the same lab we grew close after our random conversations and yuktahar meals in the recent year. I know you value and care people a lot, it shows in the little things you remember and that's what is special about you. It’s been great getting to know you during this time. Hoping for many more great days ahead!! Wish you good luck on your life journey and keep in touch! #chuckaboo

Mujhe room se bahar jaana pasand nahi but pata nahi kitna tu mujhe kheech ke JC, Movie, Minecraft, kahi na kahi le jata tha. Kuch bhi bada plan hu, if you dont lead it, fir nahi hone wala vo, Remember this for future. Baat karte rehna kabhi kabhi

Hanging out with him is always an adventure, and my wallet still hasn't recovered. Just don’t expect a birthday treat — apparently, being born during the semester breaks is an excuse for freeloading.

So fortunate to have met a person like him.

What’s surprising though? He’s ridiculously punctual — not just with classes and assignments, but also with the latest gossip. Those late-night talks in Bakul and the trips was really fun!!

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Came to the campus right during lockdown, and we were put in quarantine. But that didn't stop us from enjoying :) Standing in line with the plates for meals, sneaking out of the quarantine area, playing table tennis on bakul tables, meeting friends and making more :) It was very fun times

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Really hard to point out to one event, but those late night walks, drenching in rain, midnight movies, last second submissions, wall painting, match streams, badminton, bakul concerts, unlimited mafia, scamming course projects ;) impossible to choose from the infinite memories made

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: All the chaos that my friends bring to the table, the late night walks, Oreo shake, the dogs, the deep philosophical discussions about life, and maybe the profs?? I'll let you know when I start missing,.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer:
Hehe :) pass
But among the other big changes, would be my understanding and ability to speak in Hindi, my badminton skills. And obviously the knowledge, I've forgotten all of the PCM I knew ;) for all the TCS I've learnt

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Another year around here, then potentially a PhD. But who knows what random thing will change my mind. Afterall, IIIT has changed me drastically over the last 4 years :)

I think that Sreyas can bring up the vibe of any party and has the perfect work-life balance. It's been a real honor to be in the same batch as this beast and I hope we'll stay in touch in the future :))

You are the calmest and one of the most warm people in campus i know of. I always loved talking to you whenever we met. Stay healthy and all the best in whatever you do :)))
handsome and kind and calm

Its very easy for me to find faults in people. I have known Sreyas for a year now, but still I can't find a fault in him. His attitude is just right, and he is so humble. His face brightens up when you meet him. Never has he complained, nor has he given up on things. He  is a lovely person, and one person that I can always learn from. Its crazy at times to see how he maintains his cool. I have never seen him sad, and he always replies with a smiling face. His expressions want to make you happy.

A very genuine and caring person. We've always shared a similar mentality and interests - from chess and quantum, to badminton and our shared talent of being thin. It's always fun talking to you.
I should've joined the satellite project, always had a fascination for astronomy, would've been really fun with you. Sometimes I regret not joining CQST, we would have really killed it together :)). Gonna miss all those badminton matches. You really have upgraded a lot, waiting for a finalizer match :)

Go for the long hair again bro! Just once more 😳 Very smart and very chill guy. Gonna do great things for the field of quantum 🙏 This man always faster than Ashwini fr ✅ Both of us are not going anywhere anytime soon..So see you around ig 😭

Sreyas is one of those people who can get along with literally everyone. Polite to a fault, he’s so soft-spoken that even when he wants to yell, sounds like a suggestion. Unlike most boys he bathes everyday sometimes twice. But the same hygiene standards don't get translated across the board (let's just say he doesn't wash hands before meals sometimes even after playing sports).

But hygiene quirks aside, he’s an incredibly kind soul, a hardworking teammate, and someone you can truly rely on.

We had some great interesting discussions together on various common interests maths, quantum and even ethics and politics. I enjoyed the latter two the most, ethics had such interesting questions. And we should play more badminton next year as I will be staying in Hyderabad.

Hey brooo, you're one of the calmest people I've met on campus, and definitely one of the coolest roommates I've ever had. I had so much fun discussing cricket, research and all the random stuff with you. I don't know if I'll ever find another fellow Suresh Raina fan! It's kind of crazy how many things we have in common, but we're only discovering them after our fourth year. But I'm sure we'll stay in touch, and we're definitely playing cricket once we're back on campus!

Hey Sreyas, we've met and started talking very recently yet, you've become a good friend of mine. Ashwini used to tell me a lot about you when we were rommates, and when I started talking to you, I realised you meet her description exactly.Smart, understanding, tries and keeps drama away from his life, practical, simple and a fun friend. It's always refreshing talking to you and teasing Ashwini together. I know you will have an amazing future, given that you are super talented. ATB for ur future

Sreyas,my wheelchair buddy! Eeessreyas Bhai, aka RP, aka Bor, aka Macha,
Man, loved working with you since Automata days, and then TAing the same course and building LTM xD. Hi Harshvardhan; its always fun around you. All the very best bro !! And remember I can be a good wingwoman if needed lol. Stay connected.

We used to talk and share our thoughts openly on every topic. It was always practical and learning something new with you. You have been more than just a friend to me. Let’s stay in touch. All the best!!

The bull of our group and master of multitasking! Research, web dev, internship, startup — bhai ka kaam dekh ke lagta hai ki dimaag mein quad-core processor laga hai. journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: It's COVID time, I had a strange experience on my first day. My COVID-19 test report was missing, so I had to go to Himagiri before entering college to get one. The security guard said to go right, and I walked for long distance, thinking the campus is that long on the left side also.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: My best memory on campus is when people asked me to run for Parliament, second time. I was the least expected one to win my first elections, but later on, the situation was different. Also, exploring unknown places in college showed us how beautiful it was. Made many memories while exploring them.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I being a DD student, I will miss hanging out with most of my friends, we may meet outside the campus, maybe on campus, but it's not going to be the same. I wish we didn't grow.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Now, I could speak confidently, express my opinion strongly.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Graduation lol

I wish he will have a great journey ahead and that he will be successful wherever he goes.
Enjoyed TAing with you. You handled so many college matters so well. You are well-spoken and diligent. Best of luck for your future and keep in touch!

If #DSAWrites has a million fans, then I am one of them. If #DSAWrites has ten fans, then I am one of them. If #DSAWrites has only one fan then that is me. If #DSAWrites has no fans, then that means I am no longer on earth. If the world is against #DSAWrites, then I am against the world. Proud to be his disciple. Ayyagaare naa jokes ki reason. Sole responsibility meedhe andi. Ee madhya #DSADraws kooda start chesaaru. Leader™. HR ki mail delay chesi chala help chesaavu bhai🙏 Nuvvu devudu saami🙏

Ash mowsss, our best planner and the most stable person I have ever seen! Neelo cute and emotional sides rendu choosa mows (iykyk) 
Manali lo roommates ga, Bakul lo nee bed meedha ala podukoni poyina rojulu, I will never forget you Asrith!

I couldn't have asked for a better roommate ra. I'll miss all those random dlf, mandi, sittings, movie plans etc etc.. whatnot with you. Em problems unna eppudu unnav naatho and chala situations lo help and support chesav. Chala unnayi kaani ikkada rayadanike place ledu. Oka completeness vachindi naa college journey ki after our reunion in obh. Crying is only coming. Be yourself ra. All the best for everything.

name: G V Krishna Chaitanya
tagline: See, I'll put it to you this way

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer:
Met my roommate Ram Gopal,  we couldn't eat because Felicity. Couldn't pay anything because we had no UPI. A senior helped us to eat from Yuktahaar.

The next morning I went to Kadamb and sat on a table Ishwar was at, and then used a tried and tested icebreaker "What's your favorite pokemon?"

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Too many to pick one, and I still have time to make more!

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: My friends. I'm still stuck here for another year without half of the people I know. When I finally leave, I'll hate having to live by myself. I already know it. It's probably gonna hard to find another place with the same level of cleanliness and greenery.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Willingness to break boundaries. I always was a person who did things I was told to do. I still am. But I'm getting out of there slowly. Maybe one day I'll break enough I find a passion.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: An internship, more research, experiments, a paper and then to get a job.

testimonials.text: KC is the kind of guy in any show who’s effortlessly easy to be friends with. He has a slightly unhealthy obsession with playing rogue-like videogames and will grind mangas/animes at insane speeds. KC is one of the scariest people to play Bluff with and i would instantly go bankrupt if i ever gambled against him in poker. He introduced to so many fun games but I hated how I always got into them with him during exam seasons... I wish I had met him much earlier :)).

KC is one of the most precious and loving friends I've had on campus. "I'll put it to you this way" -- I wish we spent more time in first and second years as well. KC is a calling machine in poker and the exact opposite in bluff. He will catch every bluffed card you try to get rid of, and always somehow end up winning with 25 cards in his hand. I will always cherish the time we spent on and off work - be it studying game theory and playing poker, bluff, catan, etc. Let's keep in touch for life<3
Ekkuva interaction lekapoyina one of the sweetest persons i ever met... Stay the same ... I wish you all the best for your future and I hope you get everything you need

KC! you definitely are one of the guys who form the vibe by simply staying silent and being around! happy that you are a DD -- will get to spend more time with you!

you are probably the only south indian guy whose completely i could memorise -- Gadhamshetty Venkata Krishna Chaitanya!!! i think i will remember it for a long time!

Oh, I never dreamed I'd cross paths with such a legend in college. You, my friend, are the zen master of chill, snoozing like a pro even with the exam clock ticking down to doomsday!
You're always caught up in Japanese games that I wouldn't understand no matter how many times you explain them. We're in the same lab, but I can't use you for random tasks.

Talking to you calms me down. You are probably the person with the most chill vibe going on. I don't remember how we met, but boy am I grateful. You always had something wise to say, something to guide me out of the darkness of the situation. Your catchphrases are as iconic as you. Thank you for everything, hope to meet you in the future.

You're such a cool guy, the only person who I'd consider my senior when it comes to cultivation manhwa kuku. I met you later than I would've wanted in college, but GCR was much better with you around! You're hard-working and diligent, and it shows. It's been great knowing you, Keep in touch!

Thanks a lot bhai,
You are also a great man. You are calm and a chill person. Whenever I talked to you , and had academic tensions, I got rid of all those tensions and got into the flow of talk....Thanks for being those very rare friends who have contributed this extremely positive way.

GVK💥💥 KC💥💥 Fellow Arcane enjoyer (impeccable taste). IoT project ki parichayam ayyavu. But sadly appati nunchi malli peddaga interact avvaledu. Very sweet person and very soft-spoken. Kalustu undaam ee year hopefully

Underrated guy, and I also wish I knew you since first sem. But we had such a great time in the last few months. One year back, I would never have thought that I would get so much interested in board games and spend such a great time with you all. The more I knew you, the more I found matching hobbies, be it games, manga or our philosophy discussions. Good job picking up all the bluffs we did. I hope our plan to stay connected (not least through online gameplay) goes well!

My KFC(KC), to be honest, ur the guy that I have perfectly synced with the way u think (vibe match).
Even I wish we had met earlier, thank you for resolving a lot of the life problems I came to you with. You have been very kind to me and a fu**in good friend, it means a lot, u were there.
Thank you for being as slow as me in SE as a teammate🥲.
Wishing you all the best for ur future ahead, you’ve got this.
Hellooo ... , manam kalisi matlukunna random vishyala gantalu gantlu chaala unnai, i miss those ra. Chaala bagundedi those days. Kudirite kalustu undam raa
Enjoyed the occasional mess talks we had. You're a cool guy and always fun to talk to. Had fun doing the DASS project, lol. Cheers, and all the best for your future!

Serendipity is randomly talking to someone in the mess, only to be surprised they recognize you—and then came shared sports, corridor chats, IoT grind, anime, video games, Bell Liberty Academy, and endless Miyamura moments. I’ve loved how our friendship grew. Thanks for the amazing memories. I admire your no-nonsense attitude and how you handle things. You’re always fun to talk to and matched my bizarre convos. Keep slaying and all the best!

panda panda panda. couldn't believe that was really your name when i first met you. it's kind of suitable ig given your crazy sleep schedule (especially in e block), i remember nuclear alarms and almost hitting you not waking you. you're like a young cool uncle, and can talk with and be fun to people of all age groups somehow. you're funny, polite and smart and a finance guru and will probably be the first millionaire I'll know.

SWIGGYY PANDA PIDHI SANDA

HEAT (1995). Seinfeld. The Sopranos. Red Dead 2. Scott Pilgrim. Dune. GTA. Barry. all of Red Lorry. more recently Punch Drunk Love and American Beauty.

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Left my bags outside hostel to go meet everyone even though I wasn't supposed to. I was soo happy to meet all the friends I had been talking to online. Ran back across campus bcoz guard told me I'll have to carry my bags upstairs alone if I didn't come quick. Then the Srija prophecy came true🤭

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I've learnt to be open to new people and experiences while also being content. Have met so many amazing people because of this and turned some of them into friends that I'm going to cherish for a long time :)

testimonials.text:

And have always been by each other's back. I have no doubt that no matter whatever happens, we'll still be there for each other. Be it now, or 50 years in the future. Miss you a lot

wifey (and my favourite roomie) from thinking in online sem "wow shes so cool I wanna be her friend" to being this close to u, its been so good hehe. going out w you is so fun and its even better getting ready to go out. i <3 being girls with u. thank you for all the makeup and clothes you let me borrow, all the fashion advice u gave, and 4 always being there for me. i want u to achieve everything u dream of esp that big house where u invite me for dinner like u talked abt. ur so cool its unreal

testimonials.text: Friend for a life time, closest to my soul probably. The only person who knows my truest self. Grateful that I could be part of the OG Trio. Only person who could listen my heart out for hours regarding my deepest concerns. Most selfless person who dedicated hours of his time during our Internship Drive. Also one of the most unluckiest individual among the folks , but also the brightest one. I hope life takes him to places that he always deserved to be part of. I hope I stay in touch with you.

You are very very genuine at heart and the sweetest person ever. But ivanni aside, gundu look kuda pull cheyyatam ante goppa ani cheppali. Thopula gang kuda maa lanti normal manshule, chala baga matladtharu ani naaku dhairyam ichina manishivi nuvvu. There's a completely diff charm inside you that makes me talking to you feel really good. Unpopular opinion emo kani you are relangi mavayya(atleast naaku). Jaldi graduate avvali nuvvu and that day we all will be very proud of the effort you put in.

Gnana - the sole reason I could drag myself out of Bakul and head to RRC almost every day. Otherwise, how would I see this cutie?

Gnana hosts the incredible ability of bringing a smile to anyone's face (except maybe our advisor, though I don't think anyone can achieve that, haha). His company is easily one of the most treasures memories that I'll have for the rest of my life - from debating deeply thoughtful conundrums to intellectualizing the most insanely useless things, I'll miss this kid.

Asalu OG ra nuvvu, nee dedication for studies is unimaginable 🛐
'google hangouts' lo kacchitanga active undu, evaru eppudu message chestaro emo 😉
 
All the best for your future.
Hopefully one of the peakest paper loading soon 🤞

GP GP GP...He is one of the most hardworking people I know. The way that he just works towards something irrespective of too many expectations from it and doing it because it needs to be done is highly motivating. I have learned a lot from his deep philosophical and mythological knowledge on life and our actions. His perspectives on the same are simply beautiful. I will miss all the discussions we had in RRC :/ I am sure he can achieve whatever he desires. Good luck :)

A true gentleman ra nuvvu, never seen a more perfect person. So kind-hearted and humble. Last 2 sems research ani full labs lone unnaav, missed you at some IMB dinners! Nee secrets telisinappudu shock ayya, ee angle kuda unda ani. But man, you're overall complete! Will miss your heinous laugh over simple jokes & your random brainrot texts! Along with research, konchem health jaagratha. Hope you'll reach your PhD as you dreamed of!

Too good asalu nee ootha padalaithe. Fake NBA fan. Fernando Alonso of IIITH, One of the most skillful but very bad at career decisions (like coming to iiit after adv 570). Future lo Dr Vasikaran 2.0 ayyaka mammalni marchipokunda oka 2 robots gift ga ivvu. Wishing you the biggest success in future.

With humor as broken as Bakul lift and the soul of a vintage teenage online nerd, you 'entered into' my core-memories rent free. Hands down the best researcher IMO and you deserve much more than you get. Atb. If we happen to meet again, remember that you owe me a secret. Miss me Miss me now you gotta kiss(reminisce) me. UwU

GP , you are my dd mate ra I share almost everything with you , had lots of fun with you especially going to mess ra , like I dont know how my college life would be if you were not there in it , I might not have many fun memories with you but I have lot of low memories with , you were always beside me ra , thank you so much .

cutesttttttt ra nuvvu, i love youu
nee work ethic, nee honest and hardwork ni chusi nijam ga inspire ayya ra, neeku entra sollu dengutunnadu annattu undachu emo, but chaala nerchukunna ra nee nunchi
