campus ki back vachaka kuda neeku MK tho things workout ayyi oka gatti paper raastav ra nuvvu, im very sure.
all the best ra, your hardwork will take you to great places cutie

Jeepsss, inko samvatsaram undhi, but appudu kuda chaduvu meedha padi mammalni gurthinchavemo ani naa bhayam, one of the few people who appreciates and understand my movie references and humour lol, truly a mad man to be a triple digit ranker and still choosing to inspire us, thank you for existing and keeping yuktahaar alive!

Hey man the hottest man alive. sensible and mature in the bunch. nee insights kuda chaala deep untaai. maybe we should have that discussion one more tym,btw Im all gud ra. and what about uhuhh(coughing) keep ne updated raa. and em effortless ga carry chestaav ra nee style ni.asalaina style god nuvu ra. all the best ra, pure and dark soul ra nuvvu, hope you get whatever you ask in your lifeeee. will miss you man!!

Hi Mawaaa! Manam thakkuva time lo chala manchi bonds create cheskunnam, it has/will always get stronger pakka!!  I am very happy that I met you in my college life. Mana paths and ideologies are very similar and I always hoped to spend more time with a person like you.. I really hope our projects will conclude this year. Always found peace in our open heart discussions with you.  Anytime/anywhere if you feel like talking to someone, definitely remember there is someone called Balu.

punnavajhala gnana prakash sir. one of the memers of all time. very funny but also smart, focused and hardworking; not unusual to see a 3am update. its been great surviving pois, compilers and rsai with you. [insert hyena_laughing.mp3]

Hi gp sir.... One of the coolest ppl in kassi batch... Eppudu kanipinchina meer cheppe hi ni miss ayitha nen chaala... Meer kalisipoye vidhanam andarini palakinchadam is smtg i admire a lot... Stay the same as you are... Maa meeda punchulu estu... Will miss those convos... I wish you all the best for your future and I hope you get everything you need

Rey GP, Kassi ki definition ra nuvvu. Also, you are the most fashionable guy in telugu peeps ra. Very happy to have you in gurgaon ra. Gurgaon lo eskundam akkada nundi raagane malli 5th year lo eskundam. Lastly, definitely thop lanti university lo phd kodthav ra.. very soon!!

GP - I've immense respect for you. You are a really perseverant and hard working. I'll enjoy our moments during MR Project, especially one which comes to my mind is when us 3 just sat on the floor and were ranting a lot due to sem load. I hope you get your research paper out very soon and then we can party hard. It's been a pleasure knowing you over the last few years. Yuktahar meetups will remain special. I wish you the best for the future! Let's stay in touch!!

Bhai, eppudu Neetho sollu esina bore kottadu. I'm glad we have the same taste in movies(I hope) and you are one of the few people i could discuss all these things with. Chala funny and serious discussion sittings esam. But thopu vi ra nuvvu. Telugu peeps ka shaan. IIITH ka salaar. Keep rocking ra. All the best for anything and everything. Gym start chesa just 1 week back btw. Hyd ki vachinappudu kaluddham

My best Yuktaahar mate. Naku eppudu yuktaahar ki vellali anna thodu vastav. Small small talks ayna chala baa matladthav. Kepp that smile in you face bhai chala energetic untadi.
Appatlo vacchevadivi gym ki 5th year lo continue chey bhai. Nee CMU korika true avvali ani korukuntu IBM lo kummesthav ani aashistunna.
All the best bhai❤️

Gnana :) Of course I will not start with THAT talk, maintaining the protocol! I have to say you are one of the kindest, most honest and most dedicated ppl I have met on campus. I will miss your laughter on the silliest jokes of mine, your classic "MY MAN!", your extreme, extreme humility. I can't say how much I admire these qualities in you. And, you are not getting rid of me anytime soon either :P so stay in touch, lots of love, and all the best in life, and in THEONETHATMUSTNOTBENAMED!!!

GP bhAAi.....a proud Yuktahar admirer.....nenu yuktahar lo tinadaniki main inspiration nuvve GP bhAAi...will surely miss those yuktahar sessions....too active in WA grps....context unna lekapoina asalu dead grps ki pranam postadu mana GP bhAAi....one of the few initial persons who understood the true essence behind VK*....eppudu lab lo ne undakunda kasta puvvulni ammailani chudu bhAAi...IBM ki velli dummu dulipey...miss you bhAAi...all the best for your future endeavors....

PGP!!!! you're insanely smart, funny and a great friend too! RRC wouldnt be the same without you lmao; i mean we're gonna be here for atleast one more year, so ig more rants are gonna come lol; But you're soo genuine and hard working...RRC research might not look that  great for you right not, but trust me you're gonna do insanely well this year, all the hardwork you put in and the knowledge you gained (even if you dont ack it) would only take you to much better places; you're gonna do great!

GP bhayya, I will always remember your help for my TI OA. mee sainyam leekapothe maadi ayyedi kaadu. 4 2 lo nannu yukhtahar fan chesesaav. Really very good food. entha smart oo antha down to earth bhayya nuvvu. thanks for leaving IIT's. lekapothe maaku nuvvu dorikevaadivi kaadu. Needi Blr avvali ani koorukuntunna...
Intern kummeseyy bhayya

gnana 😂, amazing being, its always fun to talk with you and I like talking to you so much. You are someone who is liked by everyone. always enjoyed your jokes so much. will miss them so much and miss u too. Lets stay in touch and possibly meet in gurgoan. aa dp entanna, pichollu aipoyaru ma team antha, super undhi asalu

Such a nice, cool person. Super funny. A little bit sus as well, idk what you could possibly see in Vineeth. Will miss all the little interactions and jokes we had in lab, will try to keep visiting though. Atb for ur future, hope you get freed from your shackles soon. Keep in touch!

A very good allrounder both in acads and entertainment. Chudataaniki chala buddhimanthudi la untav. Mari reality naaku theledhu. I really wanted to talk to you many times. But naakunna mohamataniki eppudu ayyedi kaadu. But maatladukunnappudu happy feel ayya.And I really get inspired from you alot. All the very best for your future and I wish you success.

hi
You're so easy and fun to talk to(kassi to kassi) that I have no idea how we didn't get to know each other sooner. RPN was so crazy, you, ajit and ansh really carried me(even if you don't admit it). It was a totally new domain for me but you guys made me feel that we all kinda sorta got thisxD
You're so talented and a good person, and that makes a very good combo in life. May you find yourself surrounded by the best of people who recognize this and help you along the way, like you helped me:)

Hello vasikaran, nee dedication towards robotics lab and lab lo padi shaving kuda cheyyakapovadam achham vasikaran laane. Anduke neeku ee peru petta. Ninnu chuste naku inspiration vastundi shopping cheyyalani , antha machi dresses vestav. Super selection
You are a good person, I wish I got to know you better.

Hello Punnavajhala Gnana Prakash,
You're one of the funniest and nicest guys I've met. In my inital days I always felt a bit alienated from everyone, but chain-memeing with you and in CC helped in ease that feeling. I laughed a lot. Thank you so much for being so nice. love you 3000 junagandh :uwu: (please stay in touch and touch me 😘)

#RipGopingGrew

Pedda ekkuva kalavamu, but kalisina pratisari neetho matladatam was fun. Eppudu jokes vesina chala positive ga teskuntav. Ala yuktahaar lo konni sarlu kalisi matladukuna memories were sweet. Very positive and inspiring person. All the best for your future.

OG Yuktahari!! Bro just cooked up a concoction that changed yuktahar for me forever :)
I remember the first time we met in Yuktahar, and after all the conversation we had, you had forgotten Mayank's name ;)
It was always so fun to have random conversations with you, and particularly more so in the mess (no idea why)
Perfect mixture of study and play, and ability to make any conversation fun :) - thats one combo!!
Will see you around back in campus at least for a year ;)
always a friendly face. lovely interacting with him and his brainrot. really nice person and very smart too. keep your chin up, and let's keep talking next year as well :>

GP (nods)
Aryaman (nods back)

GPPPPP!!!!, bro you should be honest to yourself, you know that you are way more kassi than me!, and change your rules about choosing a fast and a slow eater!! It was fun to know about your phone's wall paper, and the story behind it. It is always fun to catch you up be it in mess or on the middle of somewhere, Kassi kid, wishing you the most and more ra!

Anna asalu cheppal ante meeru evaru ani thelvakamundhe whatsapp lo mee msgs ki fan aipoyanu adhe thelsina roju nundi, prathi roju dhandam pedthunnanu endhukate mee lanti goppa vyakhti ki respect ivaalsindhe!
Always stay in touch anna!
love you!

Hello ji, to the warmest smile on campus. My face used to just light up on seeing you anytime in the campus because you are so warm. You are extremely hardworking, and you are stressed out about courses for good reason. Always loved to see you sitting in RRC whenever i used to come, and I wouldnt leave the place without having a chat with you. Hope you do well in your research and stay healthy :)))

Hi zro 👋. I really love your chaotic energy on whatsapp - feels like every other message you send is a banger 😭. Love seeing you around and catching up in Yuktahar every once in a while. All the best, and lets always keep in touch!

Hello Gnana Prakash, whenever i used to see you (mostly in yuktahar) , you always have a cute smile on your face and I hope you maintain that smile forever. I appreciate the composure and the calmness you carry with you, and surely you are my yuktahar buddy!! I am glad I took the POIS course as I got to know you more :) ... all the best for your future goals, I am sure you will crack it. All the best bhai !!

Hello Bro! You are my best yuktahaar friend. The only person to whom I talk in English 😅. Enjoyed talking to you while having lunch. Like your simplicity and calm nature.
Best of luck for your future research and endeavors!
Always so funny and optimistic, one of the smiling of all time.

This gentleman is known on campus as GP. Always has a smile on his face and is my forever Yuktahar buddy. Always found GP in RRC and I always caught up with the RRC gossip from him. GP is a super fun guy to be around. He is super smart and hardworking ( thanks for coding up that POIS project code one day before the presentation ) and will do good in whatever he does in his life. Would love to meet up with you [ mostly to gossip about Swayam ;) ]

First off, I'm so sorry for taking away your trust on people on the first day of college itself :D. But nonetheless, you are an amazing person. Even though we did not talk much later, I would still laugh at the fact the this is the Gnana Prakash I knew from discord and the fact that you're such a nice and jolly person. Always stay the same!

Extremely dedicated and genuine person. Really appreciate your work ethic and dedication towards the courses.
Will really miss all the Yuktahar fun discussions and subtle roasts.
Atb for your future man!
during online sem from your chats I imagined you a badass, but you were very opposite, sweet lol. have a great life ahead
Hello geeps from discord 👋 Thank you for carrying me in dass 💔

Received caught on 32K retina scan display Intel Core i9-15900K cryo-cooled NVIDIA RTX 5090 Founders Edition 16TB Gen5 NVMe drive Corsair AX1600i titanium AMD Ryzen 9 8950X3D powering four RTX 5090s on 110-inch transparent OLED

Bro, you’re definitely one of the simplest and nicest guys I’ve met in college . Super hardworking, intelligent, and sharp . Just wish you had a bit more luck  — but I know you’re going to kill it soon 🔥. I still remember your support during the MR course, and I’ll always be grateful for that 🙏. Wishing you loads of success and good luck ahead.

I don't think we will be separated till one of us dies ra, i think we will travel to hell also together. Stop watching CR tutorials and using those cheap tactics against us. I still hold grudge over you for first sem CPro uk why. Be the Madhu Ik, my olympiad champ!

Hello roommate, had the most fun with you, someone who is always there to talk, someone I could rely on through the four years of my college. I have a made a friend for life for sure. Thank you for all the memories, the needless treats, the midnight walks, had great fun. Best roommate ever.

"Hi ra, Madhu"

Always caught up with work, yet a truly special character. Had the chance to team up with him for both the gender and environment courses, and it was a great experience. Despite the busy schedule, he's a fun person to be around—someone who brings lightness and laughter whenever he’s around.

Madhuuuu. Lovee Youuuu. I'll definitely miss you ra. I already started missing you after you joined CVIT. But now I'll miss you more ra. I respect your dedication to whatever you believe in, ra. If you strongly believe in something, you are 1000% committed to it and I admire that. I hope you become successful in whatever you wish to do. Please don't forget me, ra. I know I don't even have 20 crores XD.

Firstly thanks for rakhi gift... Asal most hardworking person of telugu peeps Anukunta... Eppudu saduvu pani iyye lokam lekka lekunda konchem personal tym gitla teesko... Stay the way you are... Mana ranting sessions ni miss ayitha nen... I wish you all the best for your future and I hope you get everything you need

rey madhu, love your sense of humor ra. But major humor level upgrade post bharat gen. You were the most sensible guy in goa trip ra.. enjoyed a lot because of you.  Bharat gen nundi neeku kavalsinavi anni ravali ani korukuntuna.

Muggulu bhai ani eppat nunchi peru pettavo kani appat kelli ade pattukoni kusunnav. Edo roju chetabadi chesestha bhai nee meeda.
Goa trip lo baa enjoy chesam bhai manchi vibe icchav. Nee kottha parichayalu nee patha parichayalani disrupt cheyakunda chusko. Meeru
edo roju BHARATGEN CEO avtharu babu garu!!.
Hyderabad lone untav ga kalusthu undu maatho kuda koncham enjoy cheddham trip laki podham malli.
All thest best ra madhu

hey madhuu, you've been one of my best friends ever since high school. Always love how we can call each other randomly and talk about anything. You're still hands down the best research partner I've ever had. Hope we publish so many papers together in the future:). And also hope we end up in the same uni again for higher studies. Let's always stay in touch and ilysm bestie:))

Sai bro :) I will forever cherish the nice memories we made during our trip to ICPR! I still have that photo where you are smiling weirdly :P, and I will keep showing it to you from time to time to tease you :). And also that photo of ours smuggling water bottles :)

I love the insightful discussions that we have had inside CVIT. Happy that I am staying back for a while, so will keep seeing you and the other BGen guys. Lots of love, all the best in life!

where is my bottle ra madhu? give me my bottle :lol
I will always remember exam ki one day mundhu call chesi "harshitha, em chadavale repu exam ki??".  All the best ra madhu, have a great career and be very very happy.

Madhu boii, you are the only one with whom I can discuss about electronics, hollywood movies, all my youtube reccos.. goa lo nee company chala enjoy chesa ra. Don't lose that sense of humor. All the best ra. Hyd ki vachinappudu kaluddham
Re sudan, everytime I’m around you I end up laughing ra, you’re such a smart and funny person, will not forget those times in the room with you and rudransh 😂 doing random stuff, keep in touch ra!
Sai Bro, will miss you bro, thanks for always helping in course assignments, exams. Keep shining.

Orey Madhu, campus ki vachina starting lo nee athi chusi, eeditho kashtame ani fix ayya ra, starting lone. But, naa dharidhram kodhi, neetho inka inka thiragalsi vachindhi, and I am grateful. Nijanga ra, babu nuvvu lekapothe, I don't think I would've made it past my 3rd year ra, you've been with me through thick and thin. Max manam ee company ki vellina kalise veltham anipisthundhi, so genuinely, I don't think I'll be missing you much, even if I wanted to (which i don't ;)). Love you raa cutieee

The cutest geek I've come across on campus. Its been so much fun geeking out about crypto and metaverse with you. I hope you remember youre arranging the wedding in the metaverse :p
Ive always loved listening to you talk about things youre passionate about, esp whenever you have new research ideas and you rant about those. I hope I'll keep getting to listen to you talk about whatever youre passionate about :)

"Hi ra Surya" ani tagline pettuko ra please🙏 Entra vaadi meedha antha moju neeku (I don't blame you anuko😳) Evadra Selmon bhoi..nee nunchi kaapaadaali ra endangered species ni..Hunting season open chesina daggarnunchi okate musicu😭 Ravi Kiran ka right hand..Bharat Gen ka bade bhai. Nuvvu cheppevi nijamo kaadho clarity undadhu bhai chala cheptaavu😭 Hunting start ayyaka mess ki raatle..Koncham 5th year lo maatho kooda time spend cheste baguntundi🙏Kalisi graduate avudaamu ra kaani. We'll do it
Sad to see that you remember me only as Dutta's roommate. I hope you complete your masters soon bro... Lets stay in touch and meet whenever I'm in Hyd...Best of luck!

Hi Maws! I always felt happy that I have someone like you in lab to talk with. But Bhartgen ki poyi vennu potu podichavu 😢. Ayna em parled I  believe we are always in sync wherever we are. Always a fan of your determination in doing research. Though we spent little amounts of time in talking and sharing things.. they always have everlasting memories in my heart. 5th year lo dimputhunam.. Hoping all your dreams come true!! Keep it touch ra ✌️

heyy madhuu,
you are the sweetest person i have met in college. had soo much fun talking to you during online semester. the most fun times were when we were sitting in cvit and talking to each other about how many papers we have published, how much weights we lift in gym and how smart we were, just teasing each other and having fun.

Will miss you bhaii <3

BHONTI ! Most fluffy person ever, would miss the "Mangana kya h" conversations and the harrassment we bestowed upon you. Keep helping others, like the maternal figure you are and now that me and Ashmit are gone, spend lots and lots of time with Praveen and Paneer.
Butter paneer lover, cute af chubby guy was always fun to hang around with. Milte rahio microsoft mein

A truly great friend one of the first I made on campus, and still one of the best. Always there for me whenever I’m going through tough times, offering support without hesitation. Would miss having you by my side.

Would love to stay in *Touch* : >

Center of the universe. Undoubtedly. Such a sweet man. Loves everything. EVERYTHING. I've never seen someone look after animals so selflessly. Sacrificing so much and putting them first. Julie, Garfield, etc, are alive and well due to your help.
i wish I could eat you.  
𓁹‿𓁹
Bhattttiiiiiiiii thanks for helping with all the cat rescues. Thanks for being the Universe's ultimate source of Paneer. I'll say it again, you should try cosplaying Sakamoto.

Hey Jai!

You're a very sweet person with a mellow and cheerful personality, and it's always great talking to you. You should compete in Rocket League e-Sports competitions; you're an excellent RL player. I hope to spend more time watching anime and gaming with you.

Stay in touch, and wish you the best in all your future endeavours!

it's been 9 years when I first met you, aur tabse tu bas mota hi hua hai, I still remember how I saw u in college and was soo happy to find someone ik joined as well...I got better at val hahaha, clutch intern god suits you
SE kassi
Better than paneer tikka masala☝️💥

Bhatti Bhai, you are always the warmest person around. Tumse baat karke kabhi aisa nahi laga anjaan vyakti se baat kar raha hoon. You are very sorted in your mind, and thats the best thing I like about you. You never hastate to say whats right, and that has always worked in good will. All the best bhai!! Abhi ek aur saal hai, badhiya chill marenge..

apr'22,1st grpProj in clg(iot) was d best thing tht evr happnd to me;7h walk felt like a moment,game u coded up,cycling sessions,22kRSW,hope+poems u wrote,blr surprise,series+movies v watched,ISB walks & ofc ur endlss flirting(✨lite),sittin by ur side w ur insane gokarting(& thru life)I hit a jackpot.watchin u achieve all tht u hav makes me so proud.I luv ur heart-kind,thoughtful,putting evryone before u.from secrtly meetin to stickin till the end,u r irreplaceable & I wnt u to b happy hamesha❤️

U’ve always been my goto person for literally anything-be it help,hangouts,or even those endless gyaans😭but lowkey I’ve grown to like them😂One of my first clg frnds & still one of the most fun, smart,& genuinely amazing people I know. Need to play monopoly & infinite board games & also go on trips together so famous hoke mujhe bhulna mat 😤& haa pls merko thoda pareshaan karna kam karde😭Hope u get everything you wish for(you totally deserve it)& Cheers to more memories & madness ahead!✨

loved having you as a roommate, will never forget the we spent together, doing assignments and cp, discussing random topics, and playing random games 3am :) You're soo smart and I loved listening to your opinions and takes on life.
You have influenced and inspired me in a lot of ways some a little more subtle than others. Let's always stay in touch, college wouldn't nearly have been the same without you ♥️

You’re the most chaotic guy I know,clueless with logistics,always last-minute, and somehow surviving thanks to Romica.But when it’s something you care about,you’re focused,driven,and unstoppable and that’s something I have always respected a lot.I’ll miss our long walks, your random hypotheticals,and the times you’d barge in with some wild story or some hot gossip that made Kyrylo and me go,“Ab kya hua teri zindagi mein?”. Don’t forget to fund my GPUs when you’re filthy rich with your quant job.

The thing I would probably remember about you most are our late night discussions. And since we know each other for really long, those debates could really be deep and open. I hope some day I actually convince you on some of my views. It was also great to see you change a lot during the duration of our friendship. You always had some chaotic aura around you, especially when you like a tornado used to come in our room at nights. Delighted, that someone can actually tame your energy. See you soon

I’ll remember how we interacted for the 1st time in 1-1, you had randomly called me to discuss about Competitive Programming, and our friendship has been really uphill since then. You are an amazing person and have been a great confidante over the years. Coldplay and Goa trip cld not have been the same without you, also our Blr meet up was crazy last year. Stay the way you are and all the best! Let’s meet soon (and eat food fast!!)!!

Mere bhai , best roommate ever,  kyuki kabhi room hi nahi aaya :p 
Jokes aside i will always remember going to udupi with you on random days and random time , discussing the randomest shit with you.
You always pushed me to do better , always understood everything i was without judging me and listening to every bullshit i said.
Thank you for being you. I am always here for you too.
Aways stay happy and blessed.
We need to go imagica together it would be really awesome.
Will beat you in gokarting!

Keval :) one of the most fun guys i know on campus. and also one of the first guys i had met during the freshers night preparation. those nights spent together, laughing at our own jokes when seniors were shouting to prepare us for the freshers! were extremely memorable. 

would also not forget the late night insightful conversations that we used to have, in the opp to library workspace. and of course the iot and esw teams that we formed together. 

lots of love, all the best in life!

Hamara CP bhai! You have really inspired me for codeforces, literally I used to solve only those questions that you solved, and when I learned that those were at a good rating level, I gained a lot of confidence. Thanks a lot for that!
You really are a very divergent thinker. Don't have all the answers to all your Jain questions, but it's always interesting to think about and discuss them. Philosophy kyu liya hamne pata nahi, but bahut maza aaya course ki burai karte hue aur project mai.Atb man!

Hey Keval... first off, you really need a filter man. Not everything needs to be disclosed to everyone (you know what I am referring to -_-). Kuch bhi bol data hain logo ko. Also, thoda sleep schedule improve kar lo (ironic coming from me though).
Jokes apart, you are one of the most logically argumentative and practical people I know. You are always questioning the norm, which is awesome. Thanks for being an AoT fan with me and handling the entire prog club. Wishing you the best for the future!
The true codeforces kassi. You really put your all in what you do, and its inspiring to see. Your room can use some work though. Continue carrying cstar please, and good luck!

Hii Keval,
You have always come across as soft-spoken, approachable, and someone with whom one can talk about just anything. I truly admire your passion and dedication...it’s clear you're someone who puts heart and effort into everything you do. Looking back, I also wish we had more opportunities to interact during college :)
Wishing you all the very best for everything that lies ahead. Let’s definitely stay in touch!

A special friendship blossomed from our first conversations. So many inside jokes and memories were created together. I hope you have a peaceful and prosperous life ahead. All the best for the future.

The it girl of Spam in online sem 🤭. Will never forget the insanity of you, shreyas and me coming into lab at 1am the night before MCT exams to cram everything. CSTAR is a little more fun with you there, but I hope we're not there for too much longer 🙏

One of the only few peeps that shares a passion for running. Really grateful for the 2 runs that we did together XD. Well, honestly you're a role model for a lot of people for your work ethic and intellect.
though we never talked much, it was really fun when we did!! you're super sweet and fun. your growth and what you have done throughout college is so cool!
I totally peaked when I beat you in the arm wrestling match xD But stay funny always :)

name: Parth Nimish Desai
tagline: My name is Kyrylo Shyvam Kumar

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Met Shreyu, got to know of our mutually shared interest in chess.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Coorg trip.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: Friends :)

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: A rise in consciousness.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Further self-exploration.

testimonials.text:
An extreeemly unique person. You remind me so much of Po from kung fu panda - funny, lively, and always trying to find the purpose of life :)). Gonna miss those looong walks around campus. 
You have always been there for me. Pulled me from spiraling down more times than you realize. Really thankful!
Love that you don't care at all about what others think, Never change that. Hope you get back to running soon, and continue being the best version of yourself.


And NO, I'm not gonna learn poker :)

Parth is a gravitational force holding any group of friends together. He can brighten up anyone's day because he is just so unquestionably nice. He's easy to get along with and is certainly a good influence on anybody he's with. I hope he resolves his philosophical and PhD dilemmas soon. But I know that he can handle anything that comes in the future. He's the most straightforward and hard-working guy I know and I hope he finds a direction to put that effort into soon.

Ahh, Parth :) The first friend I made.
I remember coming to the campus on the first day, and searching for you, cause you were pretty much the only person I knew.
Man, You, Shreyu and Akshat got me hooked to chess. It was wonderful playing with all of you, with the chess clock, in the afternoons, when JC was closed. (sadly, I don't recollect winning a game). Now you're trying to get me hooked into Poker. lol.
PS : Honoured to be featured in the first video on Zen Chess ;)

Parth is the kind of guy who will discombobulate you with his crack humor, destroy you in chess & poker, and flex his math + quantum skills. As a disciple of Sujit Gujar, Parth is always down to get some tea. And unlike everyone else in IIITH, he will stop at nothing to sleep for 13 hours a day. He will always be one of my closest friends.

I have known you the longest in this college. And I am glad that we spent enough time together in last semester. And who will forget you raising pre-flop without seeing your cards. You also had a great growth in this college. And I am sure you will find your place in this world, be it PhD in quantum science or job in applied maths. Will never forget your sweet smile. Be happy and keep smiling.

The wisest guy laughs that nothing is holding in back, the most authentic, unfiltered person u will meet.

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: I was quarantined for the first three days. Those days were fun; we played Mafia in the corridors. Then, after shifting to my Bakul room, I went for a walk around campus, excited to explore. However, I got lost near VC and had to ask a senior for the way back. The campus seemed massive that day.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: My favourite memory (a series of memories, really) would be all the campus walks and deep discussions with my friends at 3 in the morning. I will never forget and cherish how just a few minutes with them would give enough energy to get through all the tasks for the day.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I will miss almost everything about campus. I will miss the people who made life so easy here, who were family away from home. I will miss the mess food and all the canteens. I will miss my room, however small it may be. And above all, I will miss the carefree attitude I could afford to don here.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: The biggest, most glaring and highly grieved change on campus is the blocking of JC road. It was the shortest way to get to a good lunch right after 1 pm classes. It was also such a good place just to walk around. Now they have destroyed the buildings, and all our good memories along with that.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Nothing fixed. I haven't been placed or interned anywhere yet, so I'm a bit disappointed and terrified that I do not have that stability in life. But at the same time, I appreciate the freedom that uncertainty brings. The freedom to do whatever I want, with little to hold me back. Overall, excited and fearful of the vast, wild world out there. Honestly, you'll have to check back in a few months for a more definitive answer, if you don't mind. (I'll have to do that as well.)

testimonials.text: Bro we've been through a lot of shit together.... More than most people can imagine.... You have some real potential locked in you.... Please don't let it go waste for petty shit like we did in college.... Unleash that hidden juggernaut in you and let it go wild

journal.question: First day on campus?

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Performing music on stage was always great! I loved playing in Felicity and Octave, particularly with Anubhav and band -- uh wait -- Bhalu and band! I have very fond memories from being part of CCC, Pentaprism and Cyclorama too.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: The people for sure. I've met so many nice people here, some became closer friends than others. Not just my batchmates but seniors and juniors too. I'll miss performing and jamming with my musician friends. I'll miss the dogs and cats. And I'll surely miss Raj Anna's chai.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: My hair lol. Also my guitar skills. I walked in knowing only one thing for certain, that I wanted to learn the guitar. And so I did :)

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Overwhelmed. Anxious, excited, but at the same time, nervous. I got to have a very quick peek at the campus, before we were sent to our quarantine rooms, since we came during the times of COVID 19. The place seemed wonderful, filled with a lot of bright minds, some of which I met on day one itself!

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Party song. Standing beside the the music deck, when they played the 'Felicity Party Song' on the main screen at the stage. This video and the weeks of effort that took up the days and nights of me and my team to make it will always have a special spot in my heart.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: The gym culture. I made a huge amount of friends at the gym, and the guys who seemed the most intimidating turned out to be the sweetest. Everybody greeted each other with a big warm smile, gritty handshake and a lame joke to come along, and sadly, you don't really get that anywhere else.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Mindset. Came in with a victim mentality, and did not think I would grow into somebody who would have more than 2 friends. But well, UG2k21 had one of the best people I've ever met, and everyone was super encouraging towards whatever I wanted to do. I'd go as far as to say that I am much closer to discovering myself after being in IIIT. Working out, dancing, filmmaking, video editing, running, leading clubs, Felicity core team. Didn't imagine I'd have all that on my list, but I'm super grateful.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Self exploration. IIIT got me started into finding who I truly am. A lot of experiences, many academic, many non academic, but now I crave for more. I was taught perseverance and always striving for better. I wanna explore myself as much as I can, and try out all the things that make me click. And surely, my life at this college has made me capable enough to tackle whatever comes, and I've never been more ready for it.

name: Aadarsh Devanand
tagline: I'm just a simple man trying to make my way in the universe

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Arrived on campus alone, unpacked in silence. At 10PM, got a text: "If you want to sleep, just call me." Terrified at first, given it was my first day away from home, then realized it was my roommate. Met him and his friends by midnight, kicking off one of the best weeks of my life. Unforgettable🥹.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: My sleep cycle... I used to sleep at 11PM and wake up at 4.30AM once upon a time... then went on to sleep at 4 almost everyday. One more would be my hair... had the best hair (not exaggerating), now i struggle to grow it😭

21 March, 2022.

journal.answer: Ranting before exams with friends, pretending to study but actually planning post-exam dinner — with chai, overthinking, and zero notes.

journal.answer: Those planned and unplanned chill talks that began with study plans and ended with life gyaan, laughter, and endless leg-pulling

journal.answer: From lost fresher to last-minute saviour — older, wiser, and surrounded by friends.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Making more memories, chasing bigger dreams, learning new lessons, and keeping the old bonds alive — with a cup of chai in hand, always.

name: K Gnaneswar
tagline: Nani Standard Time (NST) is THE standard time.

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Being from Hyderabad, we talked with the administrators and got permission to home-quarantine and come to campus after the online semester. So we got to experience it in its full glory, as that was when Felicity 2022 happened. Still remember roaming around and participating in Kalakshetra.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Working as part of Team Wanderlust for the US Cansat 2024 competition.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: The hostel memories. Gaming sessions, movie nights, board games, group dinners and the like.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Being part of multiple student bodies and research work in general, my confidence in dealing with administration, managing teams, etc., has greatly improved.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Exploring the area of hardware-software interface, pursuing a career in related companies, and hanging out with friends while playing games and watching movies. :)

name: Poorvi H C
tagline: "How can a person know everything at 18 and nothing at 22"

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: My first day on campus was nerve-racking. After high school and a semester online, the energy shift was welcome but overwhelming. Introducing myself to 280 batchmates was scary. That night, I fell asleep to the Arjun Kanungo concert outside, hopeful for the 3-4 years ahead.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: All the late nights spent cramming, coding rounds, jamming in srujana, late night JC-runs, ginger tea, David cup noodles, loitering in the labs, midnight walks with a special someone, felicity, being on stage, 5 am convos, date debriefs, gossiping with the girlies are all unforgettable memories.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I’ll miss the proximity the most—familiar faces all around, random run-ins, daily updates, mess chats. The comfort, the belonging. Nights might feel lonelier, hallways a bit emptier. They say it’s the people who make the place—guess they were right.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: First-year me would be shocked at how much I’ve changed. From mindset to confidence, I’ve grown in ways I didn’t expect. I picked up a few bad habits but overcame struggles I once thought I’d never move past. I’m less anxious, more grounded, and have truly lived the college experience. The ups and downs were real, but I made the most of it. With one year left, I hope to learn even more, grow further, and walk out proud, knowing I gave it my all.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: ನನಗೆ ಏನು, ನಾನು ಇನ್ನೊಂದು ವರ್ಷ ಇನ್ನೂ ಇಲ್ಲಿಯೇ ಇದ್ದೀನಿ…

name: Prakul Agrawal
tagline: With great power... comes great need to take a nap

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: I can't remember most of it, but maybe the taxi cab journey from the airport. Seeing Hyderabad for the first time, and then entering (the Covid-quarantined) Bakul for the first time, unaware that I would be spending the next 4 years here. Oh and I recall washroom hunting lol. And mosquito killing :)

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: For me it is the AoT watch nights, ordering Lapinoz Pizza (we abused ze BOGO deals) and me trying my best to prevent spoilers from reaching the gang. Arnav, Shiven, Sriram, Ujjwal, and I are watching anime and eating pizza... those are my most precious memories.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I mean, I would miss our "binge AoT and chill" nights. But besides that, I would miss being a part of the programming club (not the logistics, though), and I would also miss all the outings I have had with various friend groups.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Changes in me? Well... my sleep schedule. I am happy to say, I have become one with the night creatures now. Jokes apart, I think probably the fact that I am more inclined to have stronger views about things now, thanks to my roommate encouraging me to have an opinion. Oh and I went from a negligible sense of humour to a horrible sense of humour. I blame my roommate for this too. Ruining my blissful ignorance of the meme world and all.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer:
Good question? Does anyone know the answer... Oh, wait, for me it is probably research itself. They won't let CNDs go that easily now, would they?
But yeah, I will probably complete internships and hope to join one of the companies as a full-time employee. Then we shall see whether I prefer corporate or academia.
Although, need to learn to enjoy life more. So let's see, might also try to have a little more fun :p

testimonials.text: You are the nicest, most helpful roommate I could have asked for. It was fun teaching you about new memes and watching you be confused about every new one. I will miss everything, from the DSA discussions to the random late night talks. I apologize for ruining your sleep schedule, hope it doesn’t stick. You’re the most genuine person I have ever met. Loved having you throughout the journey. P.S. AOT is amazing, thank you for introducing it (forcing me to watch it)!

Peak golden retriever energy from this boi. Thank you for introducing me to AoT, and no thanks to you and Anika for stealing all the As in CNS courses T_T.

I will not get tired of pulling your leg, just please remember to take better care of your health - we cant keep pulling all nighters forever and ig it should end with CND now. All the best, and do really, really well!

Hi Prakuli, you're a really good person,too good sometimes. Cut yourself some slack please and don't compromise on anything that's important to you. From the ERC escape room event where I kept correcting you and you got more pissed,not letting you write notes, sending a pen flying across inlp,fighting with you over answers, running prakuli gif,listening to your same nano particle rant for the 100th time, you being pregnant with a water balloon are all cherished memories. Thanks for everything xD

My CND brother, Bangalore kid and overall one the most coolest and sweetest person i ever had the chance to befriend. (soak it in, I am not gonna be this nice again).. All those long nights doing projects together, dealing with science lab, nightmarish courses, even more horrible exam schedules, AoT binge, seeing you soo stressed out of your mind and still coming out doing better than all of us. You made college incredible and CND bearable.

Cheers to one more year together in this hellhole <3

Hi Prakul, you’re one of the most honest and hardworking people I know. So glad DSA taship gave me friends like you. You’re so incredibly smart ans still so humble, and I’ll always be grateful for all your help—especially for ACA (i probably wouldn't have passd without you). Also, it’s way too easy (and fun) to gaslight you. Wishing you all the best for the future—you’ll kill it for sure.
P.S. You’re never getting my stickers.

prakul im very glad to know you since you ensure that i will always remain the second-most gullible person. you're a real nice person and i had a great time being your inlp teammate last sem. im so excited to being your wingmate for our final year here and i have absolutely no good intention. i will annoy you a lot and make sure i never lay my eyes on any episode of aot :P

PS: Is it wrong to not be special? No, esp when you're prakul, who made me watch 140 hrs of anime. u have superpowers :p

My first roommate! First year was fun bro, thanks for saving my ass when I got absolutely washed in house party. Also the only anime I've watched is thanks to you so that's pretty cool. Hope to hang out with you again in 5th year!

Prakuli, (used Anika's name here lol ) You're such a weird but awesome guy (I mean it in the best way). You are very kind-hearted and it's awesome knowing you. Just know I still always want to beat you  !!

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Spent the first few days in quarantine, talking to my roomie Roja and eating mess food out of those sad plastic bag-like containers. Sometimes, we would play cards or just gossip with other girls in the common areas:)

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Chilling with my friends after exams, carrying a speaker around with songs playing. There was a strong and cool breeze and we were just singing along...

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I will miss our CND batch emergency meetings when no one had any clue about the assignment or the exam next day, and we would sit together in lab or video call all night and figure things out

journal.answer: I've become more open to meeting new people and trying new experiences!

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Time will tell:)

name: Mayank Goel
tagline: Quantum by degree, chaos by nature

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Gladly new batches are not welcomed with Quarantine nowadays.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: For me probably the One Piece Dragon wall painting. Spent 150 hours of my life on that.. don't ever ask an anime fan to pick an artpiece they will choose the hardest. From regular all nighters, dozen new people joining along and painting together to 3 grade drop that sem. It was truly unforgettable

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: It's really hardest to pick one thing over many others.. but for me it would probably be the people. Everyone here was enthusiastic about something or the other and they pursued it passionately. And that passion was contagious. Be it CanSat, Club events, Wall painting, learning guitar or research.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I can wake and sleep anytime of the day now.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Unfortunately I am CND.. only my advisor knows.

testimonials.text: Gives good life advice. Has a terrible sleep schedule. Remains underground for a long time.

Mayank :) Roomate for 3 years.. Always enjoyed the green tea we made late in the night, or those chess games we played. It was very fun, be it recording your dance assignment or singing on birthday, taking intro xD. Extreme hardworker.. I see you in the room ;) never lose the trait, it will take you places :)

I have never seen someone so invested in learning Telugu. At this rate, you'll probably end up speaking like a native by the time we graduate. Very talented and very passionate about the stuff he does. Vache samvatsaram kooda ilaage telugu nerchukuntu untaavu ani aasistunna. Go figure out what that means :)

Mayank is the most unplanned guy I’ve ever known—basically an owl, awake when the world sleeps and asleep when it doesn’t make sense. Always up for fun trips at the weirdest hours (and yeah, that trip was a blast!). But when it comes to work, he’s surprisingly focused and driven. Wishing you all the best for life!

Enjoyed a lot trekking Ananthagiri Hills on the Astronomy Club trip with you. Enjoyed our convos and your unique take on different topics. Wish we had interacted more. Will keep in touch. You're a hardworking person, keep it up and all the best for everything ahead!

From Eid and Birthday parties to out-of-station trips, to spooky restroom run-ins, we’ve done it all. Despite all the chaos, he’s one of the most dedicated people I know—someone who’d rather spend his free time thinking about the universe than binge a show. A great mind, a strange man, and an unforgettable friend. Hope we keep crossing paths (preferably outside the washroom) after college too.

Fashionably late, fellow dog lover & might break his arm in trampoline park, that's Mayank for me. Aaj tak jab bhi isse bulaya hain, yeh late pohocha hain, be it for classes, meets or even for his own birthday on JC :) 
But the man is full of hidden secrets. He knows German, plays guitar, works with local underprivileged children & watches Pyaar Ka Punchnama. He is intelligent, hardworking and even more helpful than you can imagine. 
All the best bhai, and smile kara kar zyada. Looks gud on u:)

Mayank — the guy who always prioritized sleep and food above all else! You're one of the smartest (and nerdiest) people I’ve met. You've been a great guitar student too—hehe. Keep it up! Wishing you all the best wherever life takes you. Stay in touch!

Dear Mayank, it's truly refreshing whenever I see you. You have a bright smile whenever we meet, and that's very soothing. You are really very hardworking, and whenever I see you, you are engaged in some activity or the other. Got to know you in CANSAT, and boy, it was such a great time. As a person, you are very kind and humble. Never have I ever seen you complain or get angry. Wishing you all the best for your future😊😊.

Mayank, first best friend on campus, I have lot to just thank you for, your amazing presence and a memory of you, the wall painting, the after dinner walks(and crazyyy talks)my first anime movie and mostly the star gazing nights, something which shall never fade. Couldn't be a great Telegu teacher, but certain you'll learn it someday. Wishing you the most and more Mayank :)

Mayank you're one of the smartest people I know. Working with you in Cansat was really fun. I admire how you are always clear on what you want - rarely do you have to think twice about things. Love how you are curious about any and everything, and always willing to learn. I hope you always keep that spirit, and lets always keep in touch!

Hey Mayank!

I don't know how you are still managing to be a coordinator for the Astronautics club, but I love your enthusiasm towards astronomy. It was a delight to work with you as part of Team Wanderlust. Couldn't have done the software for GCS without you carrying it.

Stay in touch, and wish you the best in all your future endeavours!

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Locked in Bakul, quarantine. Sneaked out 4 times in 3 days, some of the happiest memories on campus. A little afraid to be alone, but a lot more excited to explore xD.

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: The 3 am walks to TCS/T-Hub terrace, partying in Bakul/OBH, playing pool, gossip sessions in CCNSB, chilling in my friends rooms more than my own.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: The people, everyone I met was either an absolute angel or a demon. But I’m really glad to have you all :)

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Realised what’s really happening around me, what’s important and what requires attention. Learnt how to learn, to work with constraints and restrictions. Stopped caring about a lot of unnecessary things, focused more on things and people who matter the most to me. Grateful and thankful for what I have, less stressed about what I don’t.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: As a CND, quite hard to pin point. But I really hope to grow more, both professionally and personally, I would love to explore and create good memories.

name: Mihika Sanghi
tagline: Too cute to handle, too tipsy to care

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: After spending an hour taking photos at the entrance and an emotional drop-off, the fun started!! The annual fest, Felicity, was almost here, and the campus was buzzing with excitement. I remember the colourful walls, decorations, and unknown yet friendly faces everywhere. It was truly surreal!

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Exploring the unexplored! Be it the (now restricted) forest area, the forbidden amphitheatre or the locked terraces. There is a great sense of thrill and satisfaction in finding new spots around campus. The best memories and best friendships were made in these places and will be cherished forever!

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I will miss the people for sure. From my best friends to caring seniors and loving juniors, my teammates, roommates, and batchmates. I will miss the comfort this place provided us with, the familiarity of everything. Every nook and cranny here holds a special memory, and I will miss it dearly!

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: My hair! And the way attendance is taken XD. When we were in the first year, Badri sir used to manually mark our seats on a sheet. Now it is all automated with the use of biometric machines. Another huge change is the campus itself. It's currently under construction, but places like Srujana hold a special place in my heart. The biggest change would be my personality. I was a timid, shy girl in the beginning, but this college experience has helped me bloom into my true self!

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: While it is intimidating to step into the unknown, I am excited for the future. Who knows if I'll do a PhD or a job, but whatever it is, I hope it's something I am interested in. I don't know exactly what my next step in life would be but isn't that what makes life thrilling and worth living?

testimonials.text: I don’t even know how to start. I can’t believe we’ve known each other for four years. Friends kept coming and going but you were always constant and by my side <3. name: Bhole Gaurav Hitesh
tagline: Jindagi lambi nahi, badi honi chahiye

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: We arrived just after the covid, so we were in quarantine. I remember the packed food packets we got from kadamb, and stuff we did with everyone like how me, hardik and adyansh raced in the bakul corridor. In the evening, 50 ppl were sitting in a room to watch Borat during "quarantine". That was fun

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Those morning walks/study sessions on the road behind himalaya, Lohri 2022, Megathon 2022 with Pranali, evening football everyday with coach and the boys, the summer of 2023 with Hardik and Arjun, our tournament win in 2025 with Ankith, Abes and Sumit and chilling in Radhikesh's room were all great.

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: The sense of security that comes from the fact that 5 of your friends live the next door, in the same hostel and you can go to them at any point of the day for absolutely no reason to just spend time, gossip, chill or work with them. Another thing I will miss a lot is yuktahar food, such a comfort.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Over time, I have become significantly more responsible and careful in terms of academics and research work. However, I have also noticed that I have grown a bit less open and less inclined towards fun. I have embraced aawarapan more and I actively seek time alone to better understand myself. On the downside, my health and football have taken a hit due to the hectic schedules of IIIT Hyderabad, especially since 2024.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Well, first I need to finish my research internship at EPFL and then the degree. I love my research, and I enjoy it a lot. So after IIIT Hyderabad, I wish to pursue a PhD. I will most probably be doing a doctorate degree either in applications of Deep Learning in Medical Sciences or Life Sciences or in the field of bioinformatics/computational biology in some University in the Europe or the UK. And after that..........well, itna kaun sochta hai. Dekhle lenge tabka tab, xd.

Lockdown times...

journal.answer: Mastering the art of doing nothing, professionally :)

testimonials.text: Almost wrote it for Agrawal smh. I had made a lot of friends over the last 4 years, and honestly, I was always debating between 3 as to who is my best friend. All the sleepless nights (and mornings because of your dumb and never ending alarm) that we spent together, all the lame jokes and outings that we did together are memories that I will cherish forever :).
Publicly, he's 'always busy.' Privately, he's achieving world records in web series consumption. He's also a financial escape artist who pays his dues in perfectly terrible dad jokes. A true enigma.
Cutiepie, very helpful and kind, somehow manages to finish assignments before I even used to meaningfully start 🙏

Pranav is one of those person who has incredible online presence but borderline mythical in real life. He reacts to every message he sees sometimes even his own. But beyond the digital presence, he is the friend in real life I can trust the most.. from waking me up for classes, assignment deadlines reminders and to being my daily meal partner-in-crime for lunch and dinner. 

It’s truly the end of an era!

Pranav is the ultimate "uncle" friend—chai lover, always buried in work, and a proud Yuktahar fan (Healthy food mess for life!) loving a lot of proteins 🙃. His reactions on groups are pretty famous. Despite being a CND student, science never stood a chance with him. 😂 But who needs equations when you’ve got his warmth, humor, and endless hustle? A true gem!
A fun guy, gets annoyed easily (very cute). Always ready to help no matter the context and gives nice and wise advice....... an uncle. 🙃

name: Akshit Kumar

journal.question: First day on campus?

journal.answer: Parties with the entire group in my room, being the DJ (yt with tab switch + manual volume fade setup), going around OBH/campus for the after-party until all our laughter melt into one. then the after-after party with the girlfriend ^-^

journal.answer: I'm still here for an year (or more) [I need more time to decide what I will miss the most]

journal.answer: Research/Associate monk at Hemis Monastery, Ladakh

testimonials.text: of all the things i found at IIIT finding someone as incredible as you was the least expected. we can talk about anything (and we talk about everything) and it is interesting. your creativity and morals make you the beautiful person you are. thank you for listening to me, making me laugh each day and being the reason i know how beautiful life is. i knew i found a new home when i spent my first diwali away from home with you. maybe newer houses come, but home will stay the same. i love you akshit

Ngl (not gonna lie) you have taught me a lot about how to think and I don't think I'd be half the person I am today if I did not have you with me the past few years (sidenote - i have greatly admired your reaction gif library). Great roommate and an even better friend, I hope we keep in touch and get more opportunities to get drunk and piss in water bodies 💔

The memories we have made in and out of OBH are some I'll cherish forever. Really glad to have met you, and for the privilege of calling you my dear friend.

But you're one of the most well-meaning friends I've met in college, never afraid to call me out on my BS. It's a tough standard, but it keeps my ego in check - thanks for that.

name: Srija Mukhopadhyay
tagline: the sun will rise and we will try again <3

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: We had to quarantine so couldn't meet anyone initially (and I got to figure out I was lactose intolerant ;-;). Then I think sometime later Kriti and other people came so I sneaked into the 2nd floor and then the thing I always said about Kriti not being able to recognize me came true lmao

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: There are too many amazing memories honestly. I really enjoyed summer of 2023 where we used to just goof around in the workspace, playing video games and singing our hearts out. Oh and also Parijat nights when we all were able to get together were very fun <3 Finally I think just being in lab

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: I think what I will miss is always having someone to go to and hang out with whenever I wanted to. I really enjoyed being surrounded by my friends. I will really miss those random strolls through campus just talking for hours. I will also miss those shitty gym machines which made you fear your life

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I am a completely different person with I think barely any similarities with first year Srija. Like I honestly believe college changed me in ways I never imagined I would change. I think it has made me a way more calm person, also made me master the art of doing things last minute (this was written at 11:50 pm) and just taught me the importance of having fun and being surrounded by fun people :D

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Hopefully onto bigger and better things (I still have one more year of college left bro idk what's next)

name: Harinie Sivaramasethu
tagline: I did my waiting! Five years of it! in Azkaban 2.0

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Was stuck in room for the first five days (quarantine). On the fifth day though we explored the campus like we were tourists in rome. Sreeja, Paridhi, Anusha and I got ready, wore our slingbags, and took off. We even asked directions (to the library?) and got lost at a point (an achievement fr).

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Probably all the time with friends, random sidequests (atrium balcony at 3am, milkshakes at 6am, bike rides at midnights and getting lost in hyd), adventures (exploring araku caves, bicycling over highway bridges, building a women pyramid for dahi handi) and countless times I could not pinpoint!

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: my friends <3 WAIT NO BINLOO I MISS BINLOO SO MUCHHHH (To Lady Artemis "RE" Binloo)

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: my hair idk? I mean ofc my horizons broadened, I definetly unlearned time management and maybe relearned it?, appreciated home and the little things in life way more (actually stop and smell the flowers or the autumn breeze guys!!)

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Hopefully get papers, write thesis, graduate with two degrees, get a job, get moneys, go to all the disneylands around the world (IK I'm falling into the traps of capitalism but :( i love lovee), be an eternal tourist on earth (sorry no extraterrestrial plans for me), etc, etc (idk man I just wanna have fun and enjoy life)

name: Druhan Rajiv Shah
tagline: Even I don't know what goes on in my head

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Thanks to the online semester, the first (few) days were a mad scramble to meet all the people I got to know quite well online and see what they're like and whether they look anything like the images I had in my head!

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Late night deep discussions about anything from advisors to algebra to philosophy to career plans to plain ol ranting, at the OG JC, where true bonding with seniors, batchmates and juniors occurred and where everyone was an equal. I said this during the Freshers' Video and I'll say it again :D

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?
journal.answer: College was all about connections, and by Jove I'll miss all the incredible people I had the privilege of knowing in my time here! Y'all were the fire that held back the dark and y'all were what I looked forward to every time I came to campus after a break.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: I've learnt enough here to change my outlook on things by a great deal. I've learnt to find joy in the smallest conversation with friends, in the smallest discovery I make in study, the smallest little treat I get myself as a reward for work.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Now to go out into the big bad (?) world and make a difference. Academia requires altruism and discipline, industry requires diligence and worldliness; all of which I will give to the best that I can!

testimonials.text: Honestly I think the 500 character limit is no where close to being enough - I remember being very intimidated by your and your lingu skills during online sem, only to later realise you are one of the best friends I will meet in my life. Hey Druhan, I'll miss our Bakul corridor meet ups a lot. You are a really cool and amazing person. I hope you are able to achieve all your goals. All the Best!

Namaskara Sir! 🙏 You are rightly called GOD and I feel grateful to be a paraud member of the Drurah cult. Will try getting somewhat better at Kannada this year ig 😅 (Gotta climb up the cult ranks to be able to serve you better 🛐💯)

Druhan is an absolute chad person to hang out with. Never had a dull moment with him, he knows what is talking about and actually puts in the hours to pursue things that interest him!

It was really fun playing at the same D&D table for all those months man, long live the brigade of D!

Dru-rah (idk how its spelled) is one of the most lovable men on campus. He has everything going on for him - the rizz, the jokes, passion for nerdy stuff.  Bro managed to sneak into my core memories about college via the many nights we spent together playing DnD. And love him for putting up with all my shenanigans. 
If we ever happen to meet again in life, lets give a cheers to the old times with another wild DnD session. <uwu_face_with_hearts_emoji>

How's life? Hope it's better than the last time I asked you this!

You have always been great inspiration for me to pursue things like theory and open source. (You are the face of theory group in my head). You almost convinced me to get into ricing, but sadly never got into it.
The memory that's burnt into my head is that vim golf event where we battled for 3rd place (It wasn't even close, I lost horribly).

Good luck! Hope to stay in touch!
Wassup man! I wish I had gone beyond this and interacted more with you. Especially on some mutual interests like chess. Keep chilling and all the best for your future!

hii druhan. for some reason i feel pressured to come up with a pun for your testimonial (cause you were so good at them!!) but idt I can ever be better than you. its fun playing bb with you. all the best in everything that you do :))

All hail the mighty Drurah!
TRG was damn fun with you, and your math skills are literally OP. Hope I got to hang out and learn more from you. Take care and good luck in all your future endeavors :)
Thanks for being such an awesome friend. You rock Druhan!

hi drurah!! You're one of the funniest and smartest people I've had the pleasure of being friends with. Any event and any room lights up and becomes more interesting when you're there. Pool has always been so fun with you, let's please play more this year!! 
I hope we have many more bad jokes to come and hope the best for you in life :)

journal.question: First day on campus?
journal.answer: Very Fun being in Quarantine. XD

journal.question: Best campus memory?
journal.answer: Batch Trip, GoKarna and Coorg Trips, Parties, Late-night Gaming, Movies

journal.answer: Chilling with my friends, those random laughs, late-night talks, and unplanned chaos.

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
journal.answer: Started out buried in books, ended up living stories worth remembering.

journal.question: What next?
journal.answer: Bas life mein phodna hai!

testimonials.text: Sweetest guy i ever found. Bhai i dont know how you would survive in open world bhai. My brother has a pure heart, thoda lalchi hai par dil ka bhot acha hai. One of my OG CLD tutor an mate. I would never forget all the good things you did for me but would sure end up teasing you.

Yash is the NLP wizard—always neck-deep in some project, cracking models while the rest of us chill. He’s got big brain energy, but good luck catching him free. Still, when you do, it’s always a vibe. Don’t forget your friends when you hit it big, bro!

Bhaskar is your go-to guru for NLP models! Always juggling random freelancing gigs and internships (with quiet brilliance). Sweet-natured to a fault (we all tease him "lovingly"), he's that rare combo of tech wizard and gentle soul. Keep shining!
Craves watermelon

Best roommate ever ( not that i have had many ) but bhai ye banda clg ke first day se clg ke last day tak roommate raha. Grateful to him for many things like pushing me to study, do CP and lots more. Abhi to shuruaat hai aage bahut life me phodenge sath me <3

Had fun doing music project with you. You are my go to person for anything NLP or LLM. Keep trying out new ideas. Loved our conversations and will be in touch for more. All the best for your life ahead!

Mr Hantai

Never met someone as talented, hardworking, and weeby as him. Dudes anime watchlist is bigger than the list of anime he hasn't seen. I'm gonna miss sharing classes with you, bitching about stuff, hopefully we can keep in touch :)

name: Chinmay Pateria

journal.question: First day on campus?

journal.question: One thing that I will miss the most?

journal.question: Biggest change since first year?
